definition: hey/to feed (an animal, baby, invalid etc)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to feed (a child, domestic animal etc)/to keep/to raise (an animal)
to have fed one's conscience to the dogs (idiom)/devoid of conscience

sentences.english: For lil ones learning to self-feed.
sentences.chinese: 让小宝宝学习自己喂东西吃。

sentences.english: Bottle-feeding lets me know how much nutrition the baby has had.
sentences.chinese: 瓶喂使我知道宝宝到底吸收了多少营养。

sentences.english: Hey you, out there on your own, Sitting naked by the phone.
sentences.chinese: 喂，那个独自一人，只身坐在电话旁的你。

sentences.english: That he had fed live kittens to sharks. ("No kittens."
The caretakers have to lock her up and feed her through a window.
sentences.chinese: 他们把她反锁起来而通过窗口喂她饮食。

sentences.english: But she kept overfeeding her cat just in case.
sentences.chinese: 但是她一直过量地喂着她的猫，以防万一。

sentences.english: “Hey, we’re the U.S.Army, ” one soldier quipped.
sentences.chinese: “喂，我们是美国人，”一个士兵嘲解到。

sentences.english: She spoon-fed her son until he was age six and people began to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 她用汤匙喂儿子喂到他六岁，人们开始嘲笑她。

sentences.english: She spoon-fed her son until he was age six and people began to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 她用汤匙喂儿子喂到他六岁，人们开始嘲笑她。

sentences.english: There is a saying in China, "a bite when hungry is better appreciated than a feast when full."
sentences.chinese: 中国有句话叫饥饿时喂一口，胜过饱足时给一顿。

sentences.english: Life was hard enough already without four extra mouths to feed.
sentences.chinese: 生活已经足够艰辛，要再多喂四张嘴也是勉为其难。

sentences.english: He called to the hostler to fetch a peck of oysters , and give them to his horse .
sentences.chinese: 于是，他让旅店里的马倌去取些牡蛎来喂他的马。

sentences.english: Weiwei is bored with watermelon, so I intend to make some change.
sentences.chinese: 吃了几天的西瓜，我打算换些吃的喂它。

sentences.english: A betta's stomach is about the size of its eyeball, so take care not to feed your fish too much.
sentences.chinese: 斗鱼的胃和它的眼球大小相当，所以千万别喂的太多。

sentences.english: The trial showed that lactating goats can be feeded with whole corn or coarsely cracked corn instead of deeply processed corn.
sentences.chinese: 说明对泌乳羊可采用整粒或粗粉的形式投喂玉米。

sentences.english: Meg and Jo fed their mother like dutiful young storks.
sentences.chinese: 麦格和裘像一对忠实的小鹳似地喂她们的母亲。

definition: to feed (a child, domestic animal etc)/to keep/to raise (an animal)
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
variant of 怎麼了|怎么了[zen3 me5 le5]
